alert.note: Alert for Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 6:40AM AKST until January 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area, Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area, Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island, Eastern Chichagof Island, Glacier Bay, Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island, Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island, Misty Fjords, Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area and Southern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Gustavus, Hoonah, Elfin Cove, Pelican, Sitka, Port Alexander, Angoon, Juneau, Petersburg, Wrangell, Kake, Craig, Klawock, Ketchikan, Metlakatla, And Hyder. * WHEN...From 3 PM AKST this afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Total rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches expected. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Persons living along streams should stay alert and be prepared to take action if a warning or advisory is issued, or flooding is observed.
